captions.text:
It's fool of
you, you again

It''s all the same
day again

It hurts, hurts again
Haven't healed yet

It's about time
 to forget

But I still think of you
Oh
I'm so stupid

It's going to work
I almost forgot you

Quietly you stay in my heart
And pokes it sometime, you

You stay in my head quietly
Then appear as tears

The memories come down
My cheeks

It spreads hurting me
And you come again

Why do you look for me
I'll forget as time passes

That's how I bared it,
 but why do you find me

It's difficult now
Take away my memories, Oh

You are a bad news
Not any more
I'm not ur doll

Might be time to give up
But heart is always the problem
Bad habit
I still look for you
In the memories passing by

Me in pieces still
 looking at me Oh

I push it down one by one
But it appears again

Stupid like me
 Stupid like you

I can't remember why
We broke up

Stupid the same
 Still

Please live in
 my memories

My love that couldn't be
Done, go away now

I make sure so
many times everyday

But take you out
Like a fool, No

I think I'm crazy
I'm sick of it too

Look at me in the mirror
A strange vampire there

Get out of my
 brand new empire

Quietly you stay in my heart
And pokes it sometime, you

You stay in my head quietly
Then appear as tears

In the memories
 passing by

Me in pieces still
 looking at me Oh

I push it down one by one
But it appears again

comments.text:
I actually discovered K-Pop by typing "Sexy Asian Women" Into the search 
window. I'm a musician and I have to say that all this K-Pop music is kinda 
generic, full of plaegerized licks of American music.  I am kind of 
embarrassed about the way that the USA has influenced the world. I like to 
see people being who they are, not changing themselves to fit in. I don't 
like seeing the western influence over power the Asian culture. They have a 
really cool heritage and culture and all that is getting flushed down the 
pipes for profit in the American mainstream.

60 years ago when Jimmi Hendrix raped the holy crap out of a Fender Strat 
with every knob on his Marshall cranked up to ten, he changed the course of 
music. We are still listening to his legacy today. When Stevie Wonder 
started using one of those new-fangled electronical synthesizer keyboards, 
we will never be the same again.  The top slot in music goes to the 
innovators.

European music uses a 12 tone scale. Asian music uses a 10 tone scale. I 
listened to some 'traditional' Asian music on YT and loved it. It is 
beautiful. On the other hand that wooden flute and zuki acoustic 
instruments get a little boring . I discovered "12 Girls Band" , they use 
traditional Asian instruments, but play 12 tone scale on them.  Profitable, 
I'm sure, but it is a perversion of sorts.

If you're still with me, I would like to see one of these girl bands order 
some custom made modern instruments with ten tone scale. Hire a 70 year old 
Chinese women to teach them what to do with them and Voila`  .. A new music 
form is reborn.  Think of what will happen to metal music if Johnny Chang 
shows up with a solid body electric guitar that has ten frets instead of 
twelve.    

If the right person reads this, they are going to make a butt-full of 
money.﻿

comments.text:
+TheVirtuosis Why would you even bother leaving a response if you were 
going to 1) write it nearly a month late, and 2) start it with a personal 
attack? I'm not wasting my time reading that. :\
comments.author: marinx

comments.text:
+marinx
Clearly you sound butthurt and painfully dumb. Did I say anything about 
Korean girls not being naturally pretty or if plastic surgery was a bad 
thing at all? I was just stating facts. And yes 3 out of 9 may sound like 
nothing or little to you, but not in the case that this applies to almost 
every other k-pop band. Plastic surgery is very popular in Korea, and it is 
basically considered the norm to get some job done. Naturally pretty is not 
always pretty nowadays. Again this is just TRUTH and you sounding like an 
angry fan ready to bark any moment at anyone who's actually telling truth 
is just pathetic.
comments.author: TheVirtuosis

comments.text:
+kiyonexus Oh my god, I meant to say three out of nine. Now my sassy 
response is ruined. :'( I'm sorry, I'm tired. I probably wrote that since I 
was thinking that six of them are natural. I'm still going to edit it 
though lol.

Yeah, SK has the highest plastic surgery rates per capita (meaning not all 
over the entire country, but just in Seoul) in the world but it's 
definitely not as common as getting your nails done lol.
comments.author: marinx

comments.text:
+marinx "only 6 out of 9" lololololol only????? You call 6 out of 9 only??? 
Bahahahaha... That's more than half dude... Yes it seems in Korea, getting 
plastic surgery is just like getting your nails done over there... So many 
want to look the same way and so many look like clones... Eh... Anyway... 
Korea got some hot ass singing groups... But Japan got the best porn 
models... Mmmhmm
comments.author: kiyonexus

comments.text:
+TheVirtuosis Getting plastic surgery has nothing to do with having a sexy 
concept, so you can drop the weak attempt at ~shade.~ Awkwardly enough, 
only three out of the nine members in this video had work done. But right, 
I forgot, it's impossible for Korean girls to be naturally pretty lol.

And for the record, while getting plastic surgery is indeed frowned upon in 
Japan, that doesn't stop idols, actors and other Japanese celebrities from 
getting their faces touched up as well. I've been a fan of j-pop for many 
years and while it's been a pleasure watching some of my favorite idols 
grow up, I'd be lying if I said that all of them were still natural. 
Japanese celebrities tend to be a lot more subtle with the work they get 
done.

+kiyonexus Japanese idols avoid sexy concepts since idol wota in Japan 
usually don't like such concepts. K-pop groups are the only exception, but 
even then, you rarely see your everyday wota supporting a group like Nine 
Muses.
comments.author: marinx

comments.text:

comments.author: Alyssa Parris

comments.text:
+Alyssa Parris It's not quite the same, because in after schools' 
contracts, it states that when their contracts run out, they automaticallyl 
graduate from the band.  However with namyu, when their contracts run out, 
they have a choice to either let it expire and leave the band, or to renew 
their contracts.  Recently all of snsd, for instance, renewed their 
contracts with sment, which made Jessica's booting out all the more 
dramatic, because she'd just legally signed up again to stay with the band 
and company
comments.author: Monica Kim

comments.text:
It's called a graduation system, yes some of them left on their own, but 
some "graduated" because their contracts expired. It's the same with 
Afterschool, that's why Kahi left.
comments.author: Alyssa Parris

comments.text:
I loved 9MUSES so much. But now Sera, Eunji, and specially Sem (who was the 
last one to keep the original 9M spirit from their early days) will be gone 
it doesn't make much sense for me to keep track of them. Sad but true. 
And I just HATE how the Korean music industry seems to acknowledge that 
these girls are all replaceable; well, for the fans they are certainly NOT 
so don't even expect them to get the same loving reception as they did 
before. Not even for a second. We ain't dumb.﻿
comments.author: Charly Cerda

comments.text:
+Charly Cerda Frankly, when 9 Muses premiered, they had a lot of weak links 
in terms of singing talent.  They were all beautiful young women, but for 
some that was all they could contribute to the group. Members left, new 
ones arrived.  Did you not like the changes then as well?  2013 was a great 
year for the group and it seemed as if they were going to breakout, but 
then for some reason,  they released no new songs in 2014 and three members 
leave.  Do I like the fact they left?  No, I don't, I'll miss the old 
members, but I'm not going to stop supporting the members that are still 
here and perhaps the two new members will grow on me.  They've already 
started to. 

This isn't like Jewelry and losing Park Jung Ah, which at that point, they 
should have just completely disbanded the group.  I'm not thrilled with SE 
turning Sung Ah into a rapper, but we'll see.

What I'd really like to see is a group that looks like 9 Muses, plays rock 
and sings in English and Korean.  Know of any?
comments.author: Seoul_Seeker

comments.text:
+Seoul_Seeker And that's the reason why K-Pop groups are never able to top 
the charts like Pink Floyd and The Doors did. They're plastic as shit. If 
groups got the support they deserve, with fans not being okay with 
replaceable members, things'd be a lot different. Reason why I choose not 
to support a circus group like what 9M is now.
comments.author: Charly Cerda

comments.text:
I love 9 Muses, but let's face it, boy and girl groups members are 
replaceable.  We're not talking about Pink Floyd or The Doors here.
